references.paper_title: TENT: Fully test-time adaptation by entropy minimization
references.reason: This paper introduces a test-time adaptation method by minimizing entropy, a concept that is central to the current paper's approach.

references.paper_title: Efficient test-time model adaptation without forgetting
references.reason: This paper addresses the issue of model instability and catastrophic forgetting in test-time adaptation methods, which the current paper also tackles.

references.paper_title: Towards stable test-time adaptation in dynamic wild world
references.reason: This paper further improves upon previous work on test-time adaptation, addressing the problem of stability and robustness in dynamic environments.
This paper introduces the concept of betting martingales for sequential testing, a core idea that underpins the current paper's online testing framework.

This paper explores the continual test-time adaptation setting, which is a more challenging scenario compared to single-shift adaptation considered in many other papers and which is also analyzed in the current work.
